Name: Shabti of Henuttawy
Description: Brilliant blue faience shabti of Henuttawy, 'God's Adoratrice' (high-ranking priestess) of the god Amun at Thebes. The figure is decorated in black glaze with details including the headband, and the pick, hoe and basket to be used in agricultural labour. The hieroglyphic inscription in the lines on the front and sides of the figure record the name and title of the owner, with the shabti text which summons the figure to do any manual labour required in the next life.
